cab.content: From Viceroy, Home Department, to Secretary of State for India,9th May 1919.(Received 10th May 1919 at 10 pirn.)Secretary of State. Following is in continuation of Home Department telegram of 7th May : Lahore and Amritsar quiet. Propaganda column held six Darbars with excellent effect. In Lahore Mall case four accused sentenced to transportation for life and forfeiture of property. In Aulakh case (Gujranwala) three men have been sentenced to death and five to transportation for life. In this case the accused burnt a patwarkhana with revenue records of six villages. They announced that Lahore and Amritsar had been burnt, that British Raj was extinct and threatened to throw supporters of Government on to the fire. In another Amritsar loot case accused was acquitted. All qaiet elsewhere. Mahomedan situation (corrupt group) source of anxiety.OT 10975 5/19
